page.title: 14Princess Anne's Visit
page.content: On Wednesday 20th March 1985,Princess Anne visited the Abbey Hoisery Mills for a promotion visit,to mark the end of a massive expansion programme for the company. They are Nuneaton's largest employer with a workforce of over 1000 and the annual turnover is more than Â£13 million.Almost all of their sales go to the Marks and Spencer chain operating throughout the country. Princess Anne spent nearly four hours looking around the massive factory and talking to the workers.Security for the visit was high. At the end of the visit the manager presented her with pyjamas and a nightie for her children. This was the first Royal visit to the town for over 20 years,although Prince Charles and Lady Diane will also be visiting in July.
